column4: i have a printer i'm trying to setup. It's a canon IP4000r it has built in wireless and is connected through my AP how would i add it in ubuntu?
I have a PIXMA printer, too. I bought the driver from Turboprint to make it work.
feisty (pre-release ubuntu) comes with a driver for it.
(which, incidentally, works better than the closed source one)
deal with the driver problem first. You can then set it up as an LPD printer.
couldn't i install the driver without fiesty?
is fiesty pre release real buggy?
i'm guessing thats to the buggy question :) can i upgrade my current install to fiesty?
be prepared to help debugging it, but it's reasonable stable.
with a fresh install, you'll have fewer problems. But, yes, you can upgrade.
join #ubuntu+1, look at the topic and follow the conversation for a bit to see what's going on.
back it up so you can revert if necessary.
they don't seem to be to sure that its very usable at all
yes, but my experience is that it mostly just works.
backup, then all you're risking is your time.
is there not a pixma driver i could install?
well i got the printer to work through usb.... with the High Quality Image (Gutenprint) (en) driver
